page.title: 16Hartshead Service Reservoir.
page.content: One of the major{events}to change the {landscape}in our area has been the recent decommissioning of Knott Hill Reservoir,because of leakage,and the building of the new Hartshead Service {Reservoir}at a cost of Â£2.5 million. It holds 35 million litres of water and is built underground because this makes it cheaper to maintain and easier to protect from pollution so that the water does not need re_treating before use.Building took two years,from June 1981 to June 1983. The reservoir is a concrete cuboid about 135mx46mx6m.It collects no water itself but stores treated water from the Greenfield Valley.Most of the water supplies Ashton and parts of Stalybridge.Tameside M.B.C.may purchase the old reservoir and use it for{recreation}purposes.
